name: SiteVerifier
description: Verifies the availability and correctness of specified URLs, supporting various HTTP methods, authentication, and payload verification.
author: Site Verifier

inputs.name: siteUrl
inputs.label: URL to Verify
inputs.helpMarkDown: Required. The target URL for verification. Must be fully qualified, including the scheme (http/https).

inputs.name: expectedStatusCode
inputs.label: Expected HTTP Status Code
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional. The expected HTTP status code from the request. Defaults to `200`.

inputs.name: useAuthentication
inputs.label: Use Authentication
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional. Indicates if authentication is required for the request.

inputs.name: authenticationMethod
inputs.label: Authentication Method
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional. Specifies the authentication type (`basic` or `header`). Defaults to `'basic'`. Only considered if `useAuthentication` is `true`.

inputs.name: httpMethod
inputs.label: HTTP Method
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional. The HTTP method to use for the request. Defaults to `'GET'`.

inputs.name: requestPayload
inputs.label: Request Payload
inputs.visibleRule: httpMethod = POST || httpMethod = PUT || httpMethod = PATCH
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional. JSON payload for POST, PUT, or PATCH requests.

inputs.name: contentType
inputs.label: Content-Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional. The Content-Type header for the request. Defaults to `'application/json'`.

inputs.name: logResponse
inputs.label: Show Response Content
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional. Enable this option to log the response content in the build or release logs. __Caution__: Be mindful when enabling this feature, especially in production environments, as the response may contain sensitive information that could be exposed in log files. Review the content being logged and consider the security implications before enabling logging of response content.

inputs.name: responseOutput
inputs.label: Response Output Variable
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional. An optional task variable as an output to store the response body. Specify the variable name to store the response content. This can be used in subsequent pipeline tasks.

inputs.name: expectedPayload
inputs.label: Expected Response Payload
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional. The expected response payload for validation purposes.

inputs.name: responseFilterPath
inputs.label: Response Filter Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Defines JSONPath expression for JSON responses to filter data, uses CSS-like selectors with cheerio.js for HTML/XML, and specifies a substring for plain text. It aids in data validation by matching with `expectedPayload`.

inputs.name: maxRetries
inputs.label: Retry Count
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional. Controls the number of retry attempts upon failure. Defaults to `3`.

inputs.name: delayBetweenRetries
inputs.label: Retry Delay (Seconds)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional. The delay between retries, in seconds. Defaults to `5`.

inputs.name: environmentVariables
inputs.label: Environment Variables
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional. Additional environment variables for authentication. Use the format `KEY=VALUE` for each variable, separated by new lines.
